channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: World IBD Day
item.description:
Sunday, May 19, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support World IBD Day.

For more than three decades, Crohn’s & Colitis Australia has been empowering the more than 100,000 Australian's living with Crohn’s disease or ulcerative colitis collectively known as inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) to live fearlessly. CCA's primary purpose is to provide support services, advice, and encouragement to people with IBD. While we invest in research for a cure, CCA continues to advocate for world best treatments and health services for those living with IBD.

This Light Up is organised by: Crohn's and Colitis Australia

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

CCA's primary purpose is to provide support services, advice, and encouragement to people with IBD. While we invest in research for a cure, CCA continues to advocate for world best treatments and health services for those living with IBD.
This Light Up is organised by: Crohn's and Colitis Australia

item.title: National Palliative Care Week
item.description:
Monday, May 20, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support National Palliative Care Week.

National Palliative Care Week (19-25 May 2024) raises awareness for the palliative care sector, including the many benefits of quality palliative care which helps people with life-limiting illnesses to live as well as possible, for as long as possible – supporting their physical, emotional, spiritual, and social needs.

This Light Up is organised by: Palliative Care Queensland

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support National Palliative Care Week.

This Light Up is organised by: Palliative Care Queensland

item.title: National Volunteer Week
item.description:
Tuesday, May 21, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red to support National Volunteer Week.

National Volunteer Week is the premier event which recognises and honours the essential and valuable work and the volunteer-involving organisations that engage them to support the achievement of their purpose and mission. Volunteering Queensland, alongside Volunteering Australia and the other state peak bodies lead the nation in celebrating the important work of volunteers across the country. On May 22nd 2024 the Queensland Volunteering Awards will be held at City Hall in the Main Auditorium.

This Light Up is organised by: Volunteering Queensland

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

This Light Up is organised by: Volunteering Queensland

item.title: WOW Day (Wear Orange Wednesday)
item.description:
Wednesday, May 22, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange to support WOW Day (Wear Orange Wednesday).

Wear Orange Wednesday, or WOW Day is the national day to celebrate and thank SES volunteers. It takes place annually on the Wednesday of National Volunteer Week, this year taking place on Wednesday 22 May 2024. In honour of this day, we take the time to thank our Queensland SES volunteers for their dedication and tireless devotion to their communities.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland State Emergency Services

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:

item.title: Australia's Biggest Morning Tea
item.description:
Thursday, May 23, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Australia's Biggest Morning Tea.

Australia’s Biggest Morning Tea is a community event that raises vital funds to make a big difference for those impacted by cancer. Now in It’s 30th year, Australia’s Biggest Morning Tea is an opportunity for people to come together with family, friends and work mates to put on a morning tea, share a cuppa, and help raise vital funds for those affected by cancer.

This Light Up is organised by: Cancer Council Queensland

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Australia's Biggest Morning Tea.

Now in It’s 30th year, Australia’s Biggest Morning Tea is an opportunity for people to come together with family, friends and work mates to put on a morning tea, share a cuppa, and help raise vital funds for those affected by cancer.
This Light Up is organised by: Cancer Council Queensland
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Green Heart Fair
item.description:
Friday, May 24, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Green to celebrate Green Heart Fair.

The Green Heart Fair is Brisbane’s favourite free sustainable living event delivered by Brisbane Sustainability Agency on behalf of Brisbane City Council (Council) and the Lord Mayor. The Green Heart Fair is held each year in May at Victoria Park with the purpose of raising awareness around sustainability, promoting Council’s commitment to a clean and green Brisbane and to assist Brisbane residents in making changes to live more sustainably.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Sustainability Agency

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Green to celebrate Green Heart Fair.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Sustainability Agency

The Green Heart Fair is Brisbane’s favourite free sustainable living event delivered by Brisbane Sustainability Agency on behalf of Brisbane City Council (Council) and the Lord Mayor. The Green Heart Fair is held each year in May at Victoria Park with the purpose of raising awareness around sustainability, promoting Council’s commitment to a clean and green Brisbane and to assist Brisbane residents in making changes to live more sustainably.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Sustainability Agency

item.title: Red Shield Appeal
item.description:
Saturday, May 25, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Red Shield Appeal.

The annual Red Shield Appeal raises awareness of The Salvation Army, and financially supports various vital programs that the Salvation Army has been providing communities in Australia, without discrimination, since 1880. We provide active, practical support designed to meet the social, emotional, material, and spiritual needs of those experiencing hardship through poverty, health issues, dependency issues, unemployment and/or experiencing personal crisis.

This Light Up is organised by: Salvation Army

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

This Light Up is organised by: Salvation Army

item.title: Sorry Day
item.description:
Sunday, May 26, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Black, Yellow, Red and Blue, White, Green to recognise Sorry Day.

National Sorry Day - On 26 May 1997 the landmark ‘Bringing them Home’ report was tabled in federal parliament. ‘Bringing them Home’ is the final report of the ‘National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families’ and was conducted by the Human Rights and Equal Opportunity Commission (now called the Australian Human Rights Commission) between 1995 and 1997. On 26 May 1998, the first National Sorry Day was held to commemorate the anniversary of the report and remember the grief, suffering and injustice experienced by the stolen generations.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Black, Yellow, Red and Blue, White, Green to recognise Sorry Day.
National Sorry Day - On 26 May 1997 the landmark ‘Bringing them Home’ report was tabled in federal parliament. ‘Bringing them Home’ is the final report of the ‘National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families’ and was conducted by the Human Rights and Equal Opportunity Commission (now called the Australian Human Rights Commission) between 1995 and 1997. On 26 May 1998, the first National Sorry Day was held to commemorate the anniversary of the report and remember the grief, suffering and injustice experienced by the stolen generations.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Monday, May 27, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit rainbow to recognise Reconciliation Week.

27 May to 3 June 2024  is National Reconciliation Week - the theme for National Reconciliation Week 2024, “Now More Than Ever”, is a reminder to all of us that no matter what, the fight for justice and the rights of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people will - and must - continue. Now more than ever, the work continues. In treaty making, in truth-telling, in understanding our history, in education, and in tackling racism. We need connection. We need respect. We need action. And we need change.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

Now more than ever, the work continues. In treaty making, in truth-telling, in understanding our history, in education, and in tackling racism. We need connection. We need respect. We need action. And we need change.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: 2024 LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, May 28, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red, Purple, Orange, Blue, Yellow and Green to support 2024 LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day.

The creation of the LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day in 2020 was the first time in history that an awareness day was formed to highlight domestic, family and intimate partner violence and abuse occurring in LGBTQ+ communities. Held annually on May 28, LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day is the only day like it in the world. What started in Australia, is now a global event with hundreds of government departments and organisations from 17 countries recognising the day.

This Light Up is organised by: LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.xCal:description:
The Story Bridge will be lit Red, Purple, Orange, Blue, Yellow and Green to support 2024 LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day.
The creation of the LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day in 2020 was the first time in history that an awareness day was formed to highlight domestic, family and intimate partner violence and abuse occurring in LGBTQ+ communities. Held annually on May 28, LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day is the only day like it in the world. What started in Australia, is now a global event with hundreds of government departments and organisations from 17 countries recognising the day.
This Light Up is organised by: LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Azerbaijani National Day
item.description:
Tuesday, May 28, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red Blue Green to recognise Azerbaijani National Day.

Azerbaijan National Day celebrates the rich culture, heritage, and values of Azerbaijan among the local community in Queensland. Through this event, we hope to strengthen the bonds of friendship and create opportunities for dialogue, collaboration, and celebration of diversity.

This Light Up is organised by: Azerbaijani National Association of Queensland INC

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Red Blue Green to recognise Azerbaijani National Day.
Azerbaijan National Day celebrates the rich culture, heritage, and values of Azerbaijan among the local community in Queensland. Through this event, we hope to strengthen the bonds of friendship and create opportunities for dialogue, collaboration, and celebration of diversity.
This Light Up is organised by: Azerbaijani National Association of Queensland INC
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Darkness to Daylight
item.description:
Wednesday, May 29, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Darkness to Daylight.

The Darkness to Daylight event is Challenge DV's flagship fundraising and awareness event which consists of a 110km overnight run, 110km monthly running challenge, and a 10km and 3km community mass-participation event. It is a month long campaign to raise much needed funds to support Domestic Violence prevention programs. https://www.darknesstodaylight.org/

At Challenge DV we're here to end domestic and family violence. Challenge DV has been partnering with organisations since 2001 to educate, advocate and empower people to end domestic and family violence.

This Light Up is organised by: Challenge DV

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

It is a month long campaign to raise much needed funds to support Domestic Violence prevention programs. https://www.darknesstodaylight.org/ At Challenge DV we're here to end domestic and family violence. Challenge DV has been partnering with organisations since 2001 to educate, advocate and empower people to end domestic and family violence. This Light Up is organised by: Challenge DV

Wednesday, May 29, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Darkness to Daylight.

The Darkness to Daylight event is Challenge DV's flagship fundraising and awareness event which consists of a 110km overnight run, 110km monthly running challenge, and a 10km and 3km community mass-participation event. It is a month long campaign to raise much needed funds to support Domestic Violence prevention programs. https://www.darknesstodaylight.org/

At Challenge DV we're here to end domestic and family violence. Challenge DV has been partnering with organisations since 2001 to educate, advocate and empower people to end domestic and family violence.

This Light Up is organised by: Challenge DV

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

The Story Bridge will be lit Red, White and Blue to recognise Croatia Statehood Day.

Celebrate Croatia Statehood Day.

This Light Up is organised by: Consulate General of The Republic of Croatia

item.title: World MS Day
item.description:
Thursday, May 30, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support World MS Day.

Each year on 30 May we celebrate the World MS day with different themes each year, chosen by Multiple Sclerosis International Federation. Around the globe MS communities raise awareness, share stories and campaign with and for everyone affected by multiple sclerosis. It is a day where we celebrate global solidarity and hope for the future.

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 65 Roses Awareness Day
item.description:
Friday, May 31, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support 65 Roses Awareness Day.

Since 1960 Cystic Fibrosis Queensland has been the peak not for profit charity providing support, services and hope to people living with cystic fibrosis. Cystic Fibrosis Queensland funds research, advocates on the behalf of and delivers welfare, support, and service programs to people living with cystic fibrosis who attend Qld Health for treatment and support. Our mission is Lives unaffected by Cystic Fibrosis and we assist everyone affected by cystic fibrosis to live fuller, healthier lives. 

The month of May is our National Awareness month, with activities taking place across the country to raise funds and awareness for people living with cystic fibrosis.

This Light Up is organised by: Cystic Fibrosis Queensland

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

Our mission is Lives unaffected by Cystic Fibrosis and we assist everyone affected by cystic fibrosis to live fuller, healthier lives. 
The month of May is our National Awareness month, with activities taking place across the country to raise funds and awareness for people living with cystic fibrosis.
This Light Up is organised by: Cystic Fibrosis Queensland
